column4: Help , im getting Failed to bring up eth1. Im using 3 NIC the first as dchp server
if it doesnt come up, read dmesg through to make sure the nic's are detected ok
you may need to install a differrent driver for it
as long as the ips do not clash, the device should still at least come up
if you pull the other 2 nics down, does eth1 come up?
looks like you need a driver
is that te one that wont come up?
then get websearching for ubuntu drivers for that device
or how to set it up (may just need a package or two)
i cant think of anything, as long as the card is getting an irq
you could super test by physically removing the NICs
if the nic STILL doesnt come up we know for sure that it needs a driver
then you will need to setup their ip addresses appropriately
